DOC.detailed_description: This study aim determine 4-hours postprandial blood glucose insulin response ingestion cereal product differ SDS content . It laboratory-based research study open cross-over design , include 20 healthy non-smoking voluntary subject , age 18 45 year . 2 test session per subject include study . Foods consume random order accord randomisation list .
DOC.criteria: Aged 1845 year . Nonsmoker . BMI value 1930 kg/m2 ( bound include ) . Around half subject normal weight half overweight . Ethnicity . Subjects close characteristic compare American population . Not less 75 % 90 % subject Caucasian . Not 10 % subject Asian Asian Indian descent . The remain subject ethnic group except Australian Aborigines . Healthy subject : Normal glucose tolerance ( fast blood glucose < 6.0 mmol/L first test session result oral glucose tolerance test conduct within last 30 day within recommendation ( fast blood glucose < 6.0 mmol/L , 120 minute glucose < 8.9 mmol/L ) ) Normal laboratory value various measure metabolic health ( full blood count , gammaGT , AST , ALT , glucose , TAGs , total cholesterol , HDLcholesterol , LDLcholesterol ) ; Normal systolic blood pressure ( 100150 mmHg ) ; Normal diastolic blood pressure ( 6090 mmHg ) ; Normal rest heart rate ( 5090 beat per minute 3 minute rest ) . Stable dietary habit ; normal eating pattern ; history eat disorder strict dieting . Moderate level physical activity ( basic daily activity high level physical activity ( regular physical activity least 3 time per week ) Able fast least 10 hour night test session Able refrain eat legume drink alcohol day test session . Subject cover social security cover similar system Subject take treatment anorexia , weight loss , form treatment likely tointerfere metabolism dietary habit Subject give write consent take part study . Following restrictive diet . Family history Diabetes Mellitus obesity Suffering clinical , physical mental illness . Suffering food allergy hypersensitivity ( wheat , milk , egg , nut , etc ) . Taking regular prescription medication time inclusion ( except regular oral contraception medication ) Subject Australian Aboriginal ethnicity . Female pregnant ( positive test result ) , lactate , plan pregnancy use acceptable contraceptive . Females consistently suffer premenstrual tension mark change appetite menstrual cycle . Subject take part another clinical trial within last week . Subject currently take part another clinical trial exclusion period another clinical trial . Subject undergoing general anaesthesia month prior inclusion . Subject situation investigator 's opinion could interfere optimal participation present study could constitute special risk subject .
